trans-unit.source: Add a splash screen
trans-unit.target: Add a splash screen

trans-unit.source: Set your app's splash screen image and background color using Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: Set your app's splash screen image and background color using Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: Add a splash screen
trans-unit.target: Add a splash screen

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Set your app's splash screen image and background color using Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: Set your app's splash screen image and background color using Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: Set the splash screen image and background color in Visual Studio 2015
trans-unit.target: Set the splash screen image and background color in Visual Studio 2015

trans-unit.source: When you use a Visual Studio 2015 template to create your app, a default image is added to your project and set as the splash screen image.
trans-unit.target: When you use a Visual Studio 2015 template to create your app, a default image is added to your project and set as the splash screen image.

trans-unit.source: The background color for your splash screen defaults to a light gray.
trans-unit.target: The background color for your splash screen defaults to a light gray.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the default image or color of your app's splash screen, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the default image or color of your app's splash screen, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Open your existing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: Open your existing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, open the "Package.appxmanifest" file.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, open the "Package.appxmanifest" file.

trans-unit.source: You can also open this file from the menu bar by choosing **Project** > **Store** > **Edit App Manifest**.
trans-unit.target: You can also open this file from the menu bar by choosing **Project** > **Store** > **Edit App Manifest**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Visual Assets** tab and select **Splash Screen** from the **All Image Assets** pane on the left side of the "Package.appxmanifest" window.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Visual Assets** tab and select **Splash Screen** from the **All Image Assets** pane on the left side of the "Package.appxmanifest" window.

trans-unit.source: If you're changing your splash screen for the first time, you'll see the "Assets\\SplashScreen.png" path in the **Splash Screen** field.
trans-unit.target: If you're changing your splash screen for the first time, you'll see the "Assets\\SplashScreen.png" path in the **Splash Screen** field.

trans-unit.source: The following screen shot shows the "Package.appxmanifest" window in Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: The following screen shot shows the "Package.appxmanifest" window in Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the type of project, you will see a slightly different set of visual assets.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the type of project, you will see a slightly different set of visual assets.

trans-unit.source: a screen shot of the "package.appxmanifest" window in visual studio 2013
trans-unit.target: a screen shot of the "package.appxmanifest" window in visual studio 2013

trans-unit.source: If you open "Package.appxmanifest" in a text editor, the [**SplashScreen element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467) appears as a child of the [**VisualElements element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211471).
trans-unit.target: If you open "Package.appxmanifest" in a text editor, the [**SplashScreen element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467) appears as a child of the [**VisualElements element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211471).

trans-unit.source: The default splash screen markup in the manifest file looks like this in a text editor:
trans-unit.target: The default splash screen markup in the manifest file looks like this in a text editor:

trans-unit.source: To select a new splash screen image for a UWP app, press the button with an ellipsis that appears next to the **1240 x 600 px** label below **Scaled Assets**.
trans-unit.target: To select a new splash screen image for a UWP app, press the button with an ellipsis that appears next to the **1240 x 600 px** label below **Scaled Assets**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the 1240 x 600 pixel image (.png, .jpg, or .jpeg) you'd like to use for your splash screen image.
trans-unit.target: Choose the 1240 x 600 pixel image (.png, .jpg, or .jpeg) you'd like to use for your splash screen image.

trans-unit.source: **Important** The splash screen image you choose must be 620 x 300 pixels using a 1x scaling factor.
trans-unit.target: **Important** The splash screen image you choose must be 620 x 300 pixels using a 1x scaling factor.

trans-unit.source: Also, when designing your splash screen, note that it is smaller than the screen, and centered.
trans-unit.target: Also, when designing your splash screen, note that it is smaller than the screen, and centered.

trans-unit.source: It does not fill the screen like a splash screen for a Windows Phone Store app does.
trans-unit.target: It does not fill the screen like a splash screen for a Windows Phone Store app does.

trans-unit.source: To select a new splash screen image for a Windows Phone Store app, press the button with an ellipsis that appears next to the **1152 x 1920 px** label below **Scaled Assets**.
trans-unit.target: To select a new splash screen image for a Windows Phone Store app, press the button with an ellipsis that appears next to the **1152 x 1920 px** label below **Scaled Assets**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the 1152 x 1920 pixel image (.png, .jpg, or .jpeg) you'd like to use for your splash screen image.
trans-unit.target: Choose the 1152 x 1920 pixel image (.png, .jpg, or .jpeg) you'd like to use for your splash screen image.

trans-unit.source: **Important** The splash screen image you choose must be 1152 x 1920 pixels which is the correct size for a 2.4x scaling factor.
trans-unit.target: **Important** The splash screen image you choose must be 1152 x 1920 pixels which is the correct size for a 2.4x scaling factor.

trans-unit.source: If this is the only asset you provide then it will be scaled down for 1.4x and 1x scaling factors.
trans-unit.target: If this is the only asset you provide then it will be scaled down for 1.4x and 1x scaling factors.

trans-unit.source: In the **Background Color** field of the **Splash Screen** section, set the background color displayed with your splash screen image.
trans-unit.target: In the **Background Color** field of the **Splash Screen** section, set the background color displayed with your splash screen image.

trans-unit.source: You can enter either the name of a color or '\#' and the hex value of a color.
trans-unit.target: You can enter either the name of a color or '\#' and the hex value of a color.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the names of available colors, see [**SplashScreen element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467).
trans-unit.target: For a list of the names of available colors, see [**SplashScreen element**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467).

trans-unit.source: Setting a background color for your splash screen is optional.
trans-unit.target: Setting a background color for your splash screen is optional.

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a color for a UWP app, the splash screen background color defaults to a light gray (hex value \#464646).
trans-unit.target: If you don't specify a color for a UWP app, the splash screen background color defaults to a light gray (hex value \#464646).

trans-unit.source: This is the same color as the default **Tile** background color (see the **Background Color** field of the **Tile Images and Logos** section in the **Visual Assets** tab).
trans-unit.target: This is the same color as the default **Tile** background color (see the **Background Color** field of the **Tile Images and Logos** section in the **Visual Assets** tab).

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a color for a Windows Phone, or set it to "transparent", then the splash screen background color will be transparent.
trans-unit.target: If you don't specify a color for a Windows Phone, or set it to "transparent", then the splash screen background color will be transparent.

trans-unit.source: Summary and next steps
trans-unit.target: Summary and next steps

trans-unit.source: If your app takes a while to load, consider adding an extended splash screen.
trans-unit.target: If your app takes a while to load, consider adding an extended splash screen.

trans-unit.source: For step-by-step guidance, seen [Create a customized splash screen](create-a-customized-splash-screen.md).
trans-unit.target: For step-by-step guidance, seen [Create a customized splash screen](create-a-customized-splash-screen.md).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
